title: How to Make a Simple Beaded Ring

steps.headline: Gather the materials listed here:
steps.description:
Scissors{"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/4e/Scissors-Step-2.jpg/v4-460px-Scissors-Step-2.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/4/4e/Scissors-Step-2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} A flexible ruler or a tape measure{"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/59/TapeMeasure-Step-3.jpg/v4-460px-TapeMeasure-Step-3.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/5/59/TapeMeasure-Step-3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} String{"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/11/String-Step-4.jpg/v4-460px-String-Step-4.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/1/11/String-Step-4.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":325,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":537.7252584933531,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Small beads{"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/24/SmallBeads-Step-5.jpg/v4-460px-SmallBeads-Step-5.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/2/24/SmallBeads-Step-5.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"}

steps.headline: Wrap tape measure around your finger adding about 2" (5cm) or more to allow for tying.
steps.description: Mark the measurement and cut a piece of string (it can be wire, stretchy string, yarn, or regular thin string) the same length.

steps.headline: Thread beads on to the string.
steps.description: Although beads can be threaded randomly, it is more effective to plan the bead order before threading. Draw a design on paper or by lay the beads to be used on a jewelry board, white paper or on a cotton surface -prevents beads rolling away. Using the beads allows you to see the end result and make instant changes to perfect the layout. Design possibilities are endless, so don't be afraid to try out many ways. If you have designs you like, make more rings and give them away to friends. Be careful not to drop the string while adding beads, or all the beads will fall off. Work over a tray in case this happens, so that the beads are easy to retrieve.You may want to tape one end of the string down on a flat surface to easily thread the beads. Don't put beads on the entire string or you'll have to remove some to be able to tie the ring together.

steps.headline: When you're done threading, tie the string at the measurement you took earlier.
steps.description: Make sure that the ring fits before double knotting it. Be sure to double or even triple knot your ties to prevent it falling apart. A surgeons knot is a good no slip knot. Adding a drop of nail polish or super glue to the knot can prevent unravelling.

steps.headline: Finish up and the ring is ready to wear.
steps.description: Use this method to make other jewelry such as necklaces and bracelets. Adjust the measurements as needed.

Gather the materials listed here: Scissors{"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/4e/Scissors-Step-2.jpg/v4-460px-Scissors-Step-2.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/4/4e/Scissors-Step-2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

"} String{"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/11/String-Step-4.jpg/v4-460px-String-Step-4.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/1/11/String-Step-4.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":325,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":537.7252584933531,"licensing":"

"} Small beads{"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/24/SmallBeads-Step-5.jpg/v4-460px-SmallBeads-Step-5.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/2/24/SmallBeads-Step-5.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

"} Wrap tape measure around your finger adding about 2" (5cm) or more to allow for tying. Mark the measurement and cut a piece of string (it can be wire, stretchy string, yarn, or regular thin string) the same length. Thread beads on to the string. Although beads can be threaded randomly, it is more effective to plan the bead order before threading. Draw a design on paper or by lay the beads to be used on a jewelry board, white paper or on a cotton surface -prevents beads rolling away. Using the beads allows you to see the end result and make instant changes to perfect the layout. Design possibilities are endless, so don't be afraid to try out many ways. If you have designs you like, make more rings and give them away to friends. Be careful not to drop the string while adding beads, or all the beads will fall off. Work over a tray in case this happens, so that the beads are easy to retrieve.You may want to tape one end of the string down on a flat surface to easily thread the beads. Don't put beads on the entire string or you'll have to remove some to be able to tie the ring together. When you're done threading, tie the string at the measurement you took earlier. Make sure that the ring fits before double knotting it. Be sure to double or even triple knot your ties to prevent it falling apart. A surgeons knot is a good no slip knot. Adding a drop of nail polish or super glue to the knot can prevent unravelling. Finish up and the ring is ready to wear. Use this method to make other jewelry such as necklaces and bracelets. Adjust the measurements as needed. Finished.
